"Le membre @%s n'a pas été trouvé
L'utilisateur n'a peut-être pas rendu son profil public ou il n'existe pas."
"Le membre @%s n'a pas été trouvé dû à une erreur réseau"

Negative:"You have tested negative for HIV.
"Negative, on PrEP:" You have tested Negative, but are also taking a drug called a “Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis”. (Also known by its brand name, Truvada). PrEP is greater than 90% effective at preventing HIV when the pill is taken daily.
"Positive:" You have tested positive for HIV.
"Positive, undetectable: You have tested Positive for HIV, but you are taking antiretroviral therapy drugs resulting in an undetectable “viral load”. Studies have shown that HIV Positive people on this type of treatment can reduce the likelihood of transmitting the virus to their HIV Negative partners by as much as 96%.

"In June 1981 the first clusters of what was to become known as AIDS were reported in young gay men in Los Angeles. Thirty years later, men who have sex with men remain the population most impacted by HIV. As many as 20% of gay men in major urban areas are living with HIV/AIDS.
HIV is a virus that weakens your body’s immune system over time.When left untreated HIV progresses in your immune system and your body can no longer fight off other disease, which medical experts call AIDS.
Early detection can make a difference in your treatment, the sooner you’re tested the better off you are and can make informed choices, for yourself and your partners. While there is no cure for HIV/AIDS, getting tested often can help you stay well by getting the right treatment early. That treatment prolongs the lives of many people infected with HIV and lowers their chance of transmitting the virus.
When treated with antiviral therapy people can live long healthy lives with an HIV diagnosis. HIV Positive members of our community are strong HIV treatment and prevention advocates. Sharing your positive status can mean strength, empowerment and being an advocate against stigma.
Knowing your status and discussing the status of your sexual partner is how to make informed choices. You can make decisions to get tested, and if positive find treatment, or if negative you may decide to take PreP to help prevent possible infection in yourself.
Getting tested is fast and rapid and there are many free testing sites around the world. Get familiar with one and get into a routine of getting tested every six months. While we should all work toward the goal of no new HIV infections, only you can take care of your own health.
We encourage you to share your HIV status in your Hornet profile, and to keep it current, for your own health benefit and others. We can all work together to prevent HIV spreading and reduce stigma."
What do the different KYS options mean?
En savoir plus sur le VIH et le SIDA :
Nous te rappelons que %d mois se sont écoulés depuis ta dernière visite chez le médecin.
Nous te rappelons que %d mois se sont écoulés depuis ton dernier dépistage VIH.
Petit rappel amical : ton dernier dépistage du VIH remonte à un bon moment.
"Rappel amical : votre dernier test de dépistage du VIH date d'il y a 6 mois"

Vous ne savez pas ce que KYS est et à quoi ça sert?
"KYS vous permet de divulguer votre statut VIH sur votre profil. Cliquez pour plus d'informations sur les différentes options et ce qu'elles signifient."
Avoir un compte signifie que vous pouvez toujours avoir accès à votre profil. Accédez à votre profil à partir de plusieurs appareils ou encore, récupère le profil depuis un téléphone perdu ou volé.
"Nous l'utiliserons pour vous envoyer vos informations d'accès et vos informations de récupération."

"Thank you for requesting your data from Hornet.
Please send this email without any changes. It is already addressed to our support team and contains the information we need to find your data.
The details below allow us to find your data and ensure that it is you making this request.
We will respond to the address you send this email from."
"En créant un compte, je confirme avoir lu et accepté les [Conditions d'utilisation de Hornet] (%1$s) et [Politique de confidentialité] (%2$s)."
